pageContext.claim: “We don't like flag burners, I'd like to say pass a law one year in jail. You start burning flags, we put you in jail for years. We should do that.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump would sometimes call on Congress to pass a law imposing prison sentences for flag-burning, but his position is ignorant of the law. In the 1989 case Texas v. Johnson, the Supreme Court ruled 5-4 that flag-burning constituted free speech protected by the First Amendment.
